text: “INSERT COIN” blinks on the menu screen of FIX-IT FELIX, We hear a coin being deposited.
WRECK-IT RALPH is asleep inside his stump. A voice-over k in, sounding more like a confessional than a traditional

My name’s Ralph, and I’m a Bad Guy. I’m 9 feet tall. I weigh 643 pounds. Got a little bit of a temper on me. You know, my passions bubble very near the surface, not gonna lie. A bulldozer removes Ralph and the stump. Ralph’s head pop out of the stump.
Hey, you moved my stump!
Ralph throws a bit of a tantrum. The NICELAND APARTMENTS are constructed where the stump w

Anyhoo, what else? I’m a wrecker. I wreck -- professionally. Ralph appears on screen in front of the Niceland Apartmen RALPH (ON-SCREEN) (CONT’D) I’M GONNA WRECK IT! Ralph wrecks the building. He throws a Nicelander.
I’m very good at what I do. Probably the best I know.
Thing is, fixing is the name of the game. Literally, figuratively, meta... physically... FIX-IT FELIX arrives and starts fixing.

So yeah, naturally the guy with the name Fix-it Felix is the good guy. He’s nice enough as good guys go. Definitely fixes stuff really well. But if you've got a magic hammer from your father, how hard can it be...?
MARY pops up in a window with a pie. Felix eats the pie, a protective hard-hat appears on his head.

I guarantee you if he had a standard issue hammer like the kind you'd get at the hardware store-- he would not be able to fix the things I wreck as quickly. The damage is repaired. The screen reads “YOU FIXED IT!”
When Felix does a good job, he gets a medal. A Nicelander places a little medal around Felix’s neck an gives him a peck on the cheek.
Are there medals for the sweet science of wrecking? To that I say, “Ha.” The Nicelanders pick up Ralph and thrown him off the roof
Ahhhhhhhh! He lands on the ground in the mud. KER-PLUNK.
.--- And no, there are not. We pull back from the game console. We’re in... LITWAK’S FAMILY FUN CENTER The place is bustling.
CHIRON: “30 YEARS AGO.”

It’s not like I’m complaining. Well, it’s a little like I’m complaining. But I get it. I been doing this long enough to know a steady arcade gig’s nothing to sneeze at. TIME LAPSE -- The arcade expands over the years. Games ge wheeled out. New games get wheeled in. Owner LARRY LITWAK takes real good care of the place through the years.
Seen a lotta games come and go. I think about all those guys from Asteroids? Boom! Gone. Centipede? Who knows where that guy is. No, I know I’m very lucky. CHIRON: “TODAY”

It’s just after so many years, it becomes kind of hard to love your job when no one seems to like you for doing it. The arcade is older now, and all the games are more moder giant first-person shooter game gets wheeled in. The arca closes. The “Open” sign shuts off. The Dance Dance Revolution screen is visible in the background. On it we see a cycle of the dancer dancing. T dancer suddenly stops, peeks toward the darkened “Open” s INSET THE GAME: The dancer relaxes.

(calling out) THAT’S IT! ARCADE’S CLOSED! She and her back-up dancers limp off, rubbing their shoulders, limping, stretching after a long day of dancin INSET STREET FIGHTER GAME CONSOLE: Two fighters, RYU and stop beating each other.
What a day. Want to head to Tappers, Ken?
If you’re buying, buddy. They put their arms around each other and walk off screen BACK ON THE FIX-IT FELIX CONSOLE: Felix and the Nicelande are on the roof.
Quittin’ time! We push through the game screen...
The game is now in hyper-realistic 3-D.
Good job, everyone! Felix and the Nicelanders exit the roof as we pan down th building and get a sense of the world.

I dunno, maybe I wouldn’t be feeling this way if things were different after work. But as it is, Felix and the Nicelanders go hang out in their homes-- which he’s just fixed. Ralph picks himself up from the mud. He watches sadly as Nicelanders ignore him and carry Felix to the penthouse.

And I head off to the pile of garbage in the dump... where I live. You might call it a lonely cesspit of despair on the outskirts of humanity...which would be accurate. But I call it home. Ralph climbs up the brick pile he calls home.
I guess I can’t bellyache too much; I got my bricks. I got my stump. He pummels the bricks into dust and pulls a pile of brick over him like a blanket. He stares longingly at the build
It looks uncomfortable, but it’s actually fine. I’m good. CLOSE ON: Ralph, who sighs a very long sigh.

But... if I’m really honest with myself, I see Felix up there, getting pies all the time, acting like Captain Fancy. And sometimes I think... RALPH’S POV: Through the penthouse windows, he can see Fe being ushered over by the Nicelanders to a dinner table f of delicious, warm entrées. CLOSE ON RALPH: As he speaks out-loud.
Man, it must be nice being the good guy. Applause. Pull back to reveal...
Ralph sits in a room full of VIDEO GAME BAD GUYS. A sign the wall reads: “BadAnon: One Game at a Time."
Nice share, Ralph. As fellow Bad Guys, we've all felt what you’re feeling, and we've come to terms with it.
Really?
(thick Russian accent) Right here. I am Zangief. I am Bad Guy.
Hi Zangief.
Hi Zangief.
I relate to you, Ralph. When I hit bottom, I was crushing man’s skull (MORE )

like sparrow egg between my thighs. (smacking his thigh) And I am wondering, why do you have to be so bad, Zangief? Why can’t more like good guy? Then I have moment of clarity: If Zangief is good guy, who will crush man’s skull like sparrow egg between thighs? And I say, “Zangief, you are bad guy. But this does not mean you are bad guy.” Claps of understanding.
Right. I’m sorry, you lost me there.
(thick Zombie accent) Arrhh. Zombie. Bad Guy.
Hi Zombie.
Hi Zombie.
Zangief saying: labels not make you happy -- good, bad... (Frankenstein growl) You must love you.
Yeah! Inside HERE! Cy-borg rips out Zombie’s heart, shows it to Ralph.
Okay. I gotcha. Watch out; it’s dripping.
Question Ralph: we’ve been asking you to BadAnon for years now, and tonight you finally show up. Why is that?
I don’t know, I just felt like coming.... I suppose it has something to do with the fact that, (MORE )
well, today is 30th Anniversary of my game.
Happy Anniversary, Ralph.
Thanks, Satan.
It’s sai-tine, actually.
Got it. But here’s the thing... (exhales, then) I don’t want to be the bad guy anymore. GASPS. Bowser spits out his coffee and thus fire.
You can’t mess with the program, Ralph.
(miming “crazy” ) You're not going Turbo, are you?
Turbo? No, I’m not going Turbo. Come on guys. Is it Turbo to want a friend, or a medal, or a piece of pie every once in a while? Is it turbo to want more out of life?
Yeeeeesssss.
Ralph, Ralph, we get it. But we can’t change who we are, and the sooner you accept that the better off your game and your life will be.
Hey, one game at a time, Ralph.
Now let’s close out with the Bad Guy Affirmation. They all get up, hold hands.

I’m bad. And that’s good. I will never be good. And that’s not bad. There’s no one I’d rather be than me. Ralph doesn’t say the Affirmation. His eyes are wide open non-believer. The TITLE burns in over Ralph:
Okay gang, see you next week. The bad guys break the circle. Satan puts a supportive ha on Ralph’s back.
Hang in there, Ralph.
Hey Zombie, don’t forget your hatchets. We pull out to see that the meeting was held in the cente room of Pac-Man. Ralph filches two cherries and catches u with the others.

The bad guys climb onto a train car and shove off down th tracks. Ralph sits on the back with the cherries. INT. LITWAK’S FAMILY FUNLAND - NIGHT We follow the trail of the train through the power cord o the Pac-Man game to the power strip.
The characters hop off the cart and make their way into..
...a huge open concourse full of VIDEO GAME CHARACTERS bustling about.

Ladies and gentlemen, please do not leave personal items unattended. Unattended items will be confiscated. Report any suspicious activity to the Surge Protector. Last call for Tapper wagon, departing in outlet two. Tapper wagon, last call. Soul train to Dance Dance Revolution now boarding in outlet twelve. All aboard the Soul Train, outlet twelve. Ralph passes through the entrance, and a rent-a-cop, SURG PROTECTOR, appears out of nowhere. A buzzer sounds.
Ugh.
Step aside, sir, random security check.
Random my behind. You always stop me.
I’m just a surge protector doing my job, sir. Name...
Lara Croft.
Name...
Wreck-it Ralph.
And where you coming from?
Pac-Man.
Ya bring any fruit with you? Ralph hides the cherries behind his back.
Uh... No, no. No fruit.
Okay then. Where you heading?
Fix-it Felix, Jr.
Anything to declare?
I hate you.
I get that a lot. Proceed. As Ralph walks through the console. People move out of hi way and whisper things like, “Bad Guy.” “Watch out.”
(whispering) Bad guy coming! He passes a screen displaying a PSA video narrated by Son

If you leave your game, stay safe. Stay alert. And whatever you do...don’t die. Because if you die outside your own game...you don’t regenerate. Ever. Game over. Ralph comes upon a group of homeless characters, Q*Bert amongst them, who hold a sign: “Out of Order. Please Help Ralph hands Q*Bert a cherry.
Here you go buddy. It’s fresh. Straight from Pac-Man’s. Hang in there guys. He approaches the entrance to the Fix-It Felix portal. Th buzzer sounds and Surge Protector appears.
Name?
Argh!
In a gorgeous penthouse. Disco lights spin. Nicelanders d and drink. SKRILLEX DJs. Felix passes out hors d'oeuvres.

Ralph arrives on the trolley. CRACK! SIZZLE! Ralph looks up just as “WE LOVE YOU FELIX” fireworks burst over the Niceland apartments. Huh? He digs two bottles out of the trash. He uses them as binoculars, and aims them at the penthouse... THROUGH BINOCULARS: it’s a rockin’ party.
Happy thirtieth anniversary? They're having a party without me? There are ice sculptures and dancing and a giant buffet table. Eating his way across the table is PAC-MAN.
Pac-Man! They invited Pac-Man? That cherry-chasing, dot-muncher isn’t even part of this game! He slams the bottles down. They shatter.
Felix struts through the room, happy and proud.
Great party, Felix.
Why thank you, friend.
Felix, you're needed on the dance floor. Deanna drags him onto a colorful dance floor. Felix does Fix-it Hammer dance. Everyone follows along. The door bell RINGS.
I'll bet that’s Mario, fashionably late, per the norm.
I'll get it, Felix. Gene dances to the door and opens it. A smiling Ralph fil the door frame. Gene GASPS and slams the door.
It’s Ralph! MURMURS of shock and confusion.
He’1ll wreck the party.
Hide the stemware.
Get rid of him, Felix.
Oh, right. I’1l go talk to him. Carry on everyone. Felix pulls out his hammer and heads out.
Ralph still stands at the door. Felix slips out.
Ralph? Can I help you?
Hey Felix, I just wanted to check on you. I saw a big explosion or something go over the building there--
Oh, those were just fireworks.
Fireworks. Okay. Is it somebody's birthday or...?
Well, it’s more of an anniversary. The thirtieth anniversary of our game, actually.
What? Is that today?
I know!
I’m such a dummy with dates. Anyway, congratulations.
Thank you, Ralph. And to you, too. Awkward silence. Finally, the door opens. A Frogger TURTL sticks his head out.
Just a heads up, Felix, they're bringing out the cake in a few shakes.
Hi, Glen.
(terse) Ralph. Turtle shuts the door, fast.
Cake. Heard about this cake stuff. Never had it. No one ever seems to throw it out, so it never ends up in the dump. Never actually tasted it.
...yeah.
Always wanted to try cake.
(shaking his head, no) I don’t suppose you'd like to come in and have a slice, would you?
Ralph throws the door open and pushes Felix inside.

Hey-oh, everybody! Ralph’s head slams into the ceiling. A large chunks falls down on Felix YELPS! Felix drops DEAD. Everyone GASPS in horror. A little flower floats above Fe and we hear a quick cycle of DEATH MUSIC. Felix suddenly regenerates next to Ralph.
I’m okay. I’m okay. Fit as a fiddle.... Now, you all know Ralph.
Evening...oops. (breaking the steps) Evening Nel. Lucy. Don. Dana.
Deanna.
Big Gene.
(to Felix, annoyed) Why is HE here?
He’s just here for a slice of cake.
And I am a big part of the game, technically speaking... Why are you here, Gene? Ralph bends down and he and Gene face off. Felix steps between them, breaking it up.
Oh look, the cake. Mary wheels out an elaborate cake of the Niceland apartme building, complete with “We Love Felix” candy fireworks.
Well, I’1l be dipped; you've really outdone yourself, Mary. The Nicelanders gather around the cake and HAIL PRAISE.

Oh and look; there’s all of us at the top. Ralph approaches and looks over the cake. INSET CAKE: A little Felix stands on the roof, reaching f medal, surrounded lovingly by Nicelanders. But there’s no sign of Ralph.
Each apartment is everyone's favorite flavor. Norwood’s is red velvet.
Guilty!
Lemon for Lucy. Rum cake for gene, and for Felix-- Ralph looks for his figurine, and finds himself in the mu looking like some sort of deranged troll. His face sinks.
Hey Mary, what’s the flavor of that mud that I’m stuck in there?
Hmm? Oh, chocolate.
Never been real fond of chocolate.
Well, I did not know that.

One other little thing — I hate to be picky but — this angry little guy might be a lot happier if you put him up here with everyone else. Ralph picks up the little Ralph figurine. He puts him on roof, smooshing the cake a little.
My cake. Ralph pushes an ugly smile onto his figurine’s face.
See that? Look at that smile.
No, no, no. You see, Ralph, there’s no room for you up here. Gene knocks Little Ralph back into the mud.
Well, what about this? We can make room. We can take turns. Easy. Ralph puts Little Ralph back on top of the cake and slams Little Felix into the mud instead. The Nicelanders GASP.
How about we just eat the cake!
Hang on. Felix needs to be on the roof, because he’s about to get his medal.

Well, then how about we just take that medal and give it to Ralph for once. Would that be the end of the world, Gene? Ralph rips the medal off, breaking the delicate fireworks and puts it on little Ralph.
Now you’re just being ridiculous; only good guys win medals, and you sir are no good guy.
I could be a good guy if I wanted to, and I could win a medal.
Uh-huh. And when you do, come and talk to us. Gene takes Ralph off the cake.
And then would you finally let me be on the top of the cake with you guys?

If you won a medal, we’d let you live up here in the penthouse.... (off Ralph’s look) But it will never happen... Gene rips the medal off little Ralph, puts it on little Felix, and puts Felix back on the top. GENE (CONT’D) ..-because you’re just the bad guy who wrecks the building.
No, I'm not. Gene slams Little Ralph back in the mud upside down.
Yes, you are.
No, I’m NOT! Ralph slams his fist down right on the cake. SMASH! Chunk cake and frosting cover the Nicelanders. Pac-Man stops eating. His mouth falls open in shock.
Yes, you are.

All right, Gene, you know what? I’m gonna win a medal. Oh I am gonna win a medal! The shiniest medal this place has ever seen. A medal so good that it will make Felix’s medals wet their pants! And good night. Thank you for the party. Ralph exits, smashing a hole in the other side of the doo
Is he serious?
Oh please, where is a Bad Guy gonna win a medal? Of course he’s not serious.
RALPH’S HAND CATCHING A BEER. We're in a bar.
I’ve never been more serious about anything in my life. That’s why I came straight here, Tapper. TAPPER the bartender collects the empties in front or Ral
You've never given me a bum steer. Now, where can a guy like me go and win a medal?
I don’t think such a game exists, Ralph.
Come on, you know people. There’s got to be--
Tapper! Need a root beer!

(to Ralph) Hold that thought. Tapper runs off. OUTSIDE THE GAME CONSOLE: we watch the 8-bit view of the Beer Tapper game as Tapper zips down a row of bars, slidi beers to other customers. BACK INSIDE THE GAME: Tapper returns to Ralph’s side.
You were saying.
I was saying, I can’t spend another thirty years living alone in the (MORE )
garbage. I’m not going back without a medal.
Well, I don’t know what to tell you. Maybe somebody left a medal here. You're welcome to dig through the lost and found.
Ralph digs through the “lost and found” crate. Behind him see a hallway with the saloon doors on one side and restr on the other.
Okay let’s see what we’ve got here. Ralph rummages through the box. A little cockroach scurri out of the box. Ralph SHOOS it.
Shoo. Shoo. Go. (back rummaging) Mushroom. No.... What is this? No. (picking up a pair of red briefs) Oh come on Zangief. Gross. Ralph sighs, pushes the crate back into the closet, sighs
What am I doing? Just then, a heavily-armored space marine enters through saloon doors and bumps into Ralph.
Hey, excuse you. The marine staggers on and right into the wall again and again, in a walk cycle. Meet PVT. MARKOWSKI.
(mumbling, shell-shocked) We are humanity’s last hope. Our mission, destroy all cy-bugs. We are humanity’s last hope-- Ralph stands and looks at him, curious.
You okay there, cadet? Markowski whips around quickly and grabs Ralph by the col
We've only been plugged in a week. And every day it’s climb the building. Fight bugs. Climb the building. Fight more bugs. Ralph pries Markowski’s hands off of his collar.
Yeah yeah yeah, right. Hey, easy on the overalls spaceman. It’s tough all over. Ralph heads for the door.
And all for what? A lousy medal.
Medal? You win a medal?
Yeah. Medal of Heroes.
Ooooh. Is it shiny?
Pretty shiny.
Ooooh. And it says Hero on it?
Uh-huh.
And you said you win it by climbing a building?
..-And fighting bugs.
Right. Bugs. Listen: Is there any chance I could go with you to your game and get one of those medals--
Negatory.
Does that mean maybe?
No. Look, only the bravest and the best serve in our corps-- The little cockroach climbs up the wall beside him. Marko sees it and squeals like a little baby.

He goes to run away. But slams into the wall and passes o Ralph looks down at him and gets an idea. INT. BROOM CLOSET — MOMENTS LATER We see Markowski passed out in his skivvies. An armored f kicks Markowski’s leg in, slams the door, and breaks off door handle. It’s Ralph in Markowski’s armor, his gut hanging out. He SUCKS in his breath, PULLS UP his pants. Breathes a sigh relief. His gut pops back out.
The arcade will open in fifteen minutes. Please report to your games. A clumsy armored RALPH steps out of the Tapper’s entrance
(to himself) Okay, what was it called? Hero- Hero something. Hero’s...Duty! Hero’s Duty. He sees soldiers in the same uniform going into a game ca HERO'S DUTY. He follows. He trips over Q*Bert.
(flipping up the visor) Sorry Q*Bert. It’s me, Ralph. Shhhh. Q*Bert is shocked to see Ralph. Ralph flips the visor bac down. He heads for the Hero’s Duty entrance. Q*Bert watches after him.
LITWAK’S FAMILY FUN CENTER — MORNING The sun is up over Litwak’s. Litwak lights up the OPEN si
Morning kids, come on in. Good to see you, good to see you...you too, little fellow.
INT. HERO’S DUTY, TRAM STATION A high-speed shuttle sweeps up to a stop. The doors open. smiling Ralph and a few other soldiers run out. MUSIC STA Ralph looks around in awe.
Quarter alert. Quarter alert.
Ooh, sweet golden medal. Ralph follows the other soldiers. QUARTERS GO INTO A MACHINE. A MOPPET GIRL picks up the gun in front of the Hero’s Dut console.
On a planet with no name. A top secret experiment has gone horribly wrong.
INT. HERO’S DUTY, DARK HULL — DAY It’s chock full of soldiers. Ralph joins them.
Come on now, hustle up. Clock is ticking. Let’s go.
Rootin’, tootin’, ready for shootin’! Just then, SERGEANT TAMORA JEAN CALHOUN steps up before h men.
Alright, now listen up ‘cause I’m only gonna say this once. Fear is a four letter word, ladies. If you wanna go pee-pee in your big boy slacks, keep it to yourself! It’s make-your-mamas-—proud time!
I love my momma!

Heads up! First-Person Shooter coming through. Soldiers make way for a rinky-dink robot with a flat-scre head that displays the count-down to game play. Stiff mechanical arms hold a gun. The wheels are wobbly to simu walking. Meet the FIRST-PERSON SHOOTER (“FPS”).
Game play in 3...2....
We are humanity’s last hope. Our mission: destroy all cy-bugs. Ralph shoves his way to the front, right behind the FPS.

You ready rookie? Let’s find out. The door opens and the view is vicious! The wind is wild. The terrain is sharp and twisted. Giant BUGS fly towards them. They’re part machine, part nature, with razor-sharp pincers, thrashing metal teeth and laser wings. A 99-story caustic building rises up out of the twisted ground behind them.
(terrified) Sweet Mother Hubbard. Ralph is pushed out of the hub with the other soldiers.
No! Oh no no no, wait a second! Ahhh!
Cy-bug, twelve o’clock. Take it, newbie. As soldiers start killing bugs, Ralph runs around in a pa
Oh no, wait, wait, wait! He raises his gun and shoots randomly.
Watch it, Rookie! These monsters are what they eat. A cy-bug grabs Ralph’s gun out of his hands and eats it.
My gun! Hey give that back. The cy-bug’s arm MORPHS into a gun. It starts shooting. R SCREAMS and runs away.
(to the FPS) Shoot the eggs before they hatch! A Cy-bug lays a bunch of eggs in front of Ralph.
Eww. There’s something coming out of their bottoms. OUT IN THE ARCADE: The moppet girl looks confused. Calhou steps into frame, grabs Ralph, and throws him off-screen.
Markowski! Get back in formation. BACK INSIDE HERO’S DUTY: Calhoun gets back on script.
All right people, the kitten whispers and tickle fights stop (MORE )
now, the entrance to the lab is straight ahead. Ralph peeks up from behind a rock, looks at the building.
I‘1l meet you guys inside. Sanctuary! Sanctuary! He runs for the building.
No! As soon as he crosses the bridge, he sets off a sensors. lab doors fly open and a bigger swarm of cy-bugs pours ou Ralph runs up to the FPS, banging his head on the screen. pleads to the screen.
Abhhhhh! Ah! I thought this was going to be like Centipede! When did video games become so violent and scary? OUTSIDE THE GAME: The gamer sees his face pressed up agai the screen as he blubbers.
Save me! Get me outta here! BACK INSIDE THE GAME: Ralph uses the FPS droid as a shiel
Take her! OUTSIDE THE GAME: The gamer watches the camera angle whip to the jaws of a giant cy-bug, then flip down as if the F has fallen dead.
Game over. The “GAME OVER” flashes on the screen. The girl slams the into its holder and marches away.
What a rip-off. BACK INSIDE HERO’S DUTY: Ralph grapples with the cy-bug w tries to eat him.
Get off me! It’s game over. Stop it!

Cease fire. Cease fire! A beacon light suddenly shines through the center of the building and out the top. The cy-bug suddenly stops attacking Ralph. It turns to th light, charmed by it. It flies into the light and is zapp into oblivion, along with all the other bugs.
Return to start positions. Return to start positions. The FPS robot rises back towards vertical. Ralph dusts hi off.
Here, let me help you. Sorry about that, I just-- Annoyed, its mechanical arms swat Ralph away. It rolls of
Well, yeah, you must be upset. Calhoun bounds towards Ralph.
Markowski!
Who? Oh, yeah, me, I’m Markowski. Ralph stands at attention, chin raised, to avoid detectio Calhoun CLOCKS his helmet with the butt of her gun. RALPH (CONT’D) Ow!
What’s the first rule of Hero’s Duty?
.--No cuts, no butts, no coconuts?
She clocks him again.
Never interfere with the first person shooter. Our job is to get the gamers to the top of that building so they can get a medal, and that’s it. So stick to the program, soldier!
Right, right, aye aye!
Quarter alert. Quarter alert.
(walking away) All right, pussy willows, back to start positions!
Yeah, right. No way I’m going through that again.... so that’s where they keep the medal, huh? He looks up at the formidable building.

LITWAK’S ARCADE The moppet that had been playing Hero’s Duty now walks up a cheerful racing game called SUGAR RUSH. The marquee advertises: “New Racers Daily” and “Build your own kart.” BIG KIDS are playing it.
New racers daily, sweet... I got next game. The moppet goes to put a quarter on the console. The Big slides her quarter off with a whole roll of quarters.
Go away, kid. We’re gonna play all nine of today’s racers.
Yeah!
Sorry.

The Moppet sighs, goes over to Fix-It Felix, Jr. instead. INSIDE NICELAND: The intro music plays. Nicelanders take their positions. But Ralph does not. A quote bubble pops where he should be, reading: I’M GONNA WRECK IT! BACK ON THE MOPPET: She looks confused.
Where’s the wrecking guy? INSIDE NICELAND: The Nicelanders start to panic.
Where’s Ralph? He should be wrecking the building.
Shhh. Stick with the program.
Fix it, Felix!
(jumping on screen) I can fix it! He GASPS in shock to see there’s no Ralph and nothing to but quickly recovers and smiles for the gamer.
(through gritted teeth) Ralph. Quarter alert. Game on. The Moppet Girl makes Felix bounce up the building.
Do something, Felix.

Just act natural. I'll fix it. BACK ON THE MOPPET: She freaks as the joystick moves on i own as Felix climbs down the building and runs off screen INSIDE NICELAND: Felix climbs Ralph’s garbage pile. Ralph not there. Felix’s reassuring face turns to panic.
Oh my land. Where is he? BACK ON THE MOPPET: She’s fed up.
Mr. Litwak!
What’s the trouble, sweetheart?
The game’s busted. Mr. Litwak takes a look. He can see the Nicelanders and F panicking on screen and hears nonsensical computer chatte
Whoa boy, looks like the game’s gone cuckoo...like my Nana. (to the moppet) Sorry, sweetie. Here’s your quarter back. He gives her back a quarter.
But what about the game?

I’'1ll have someone look at it tomorrow. But if he can’t fix it, it might be time to put ol’ Ralph and Felix out to pasture...like my Nana. Litwak hangs an OUT OF ORDER sign on the screen. INSIDE NICELAND: The Nicelanders run out of the building watch in horror as the sign eclipses the arcade light.
Ladies and gentlemen, we are out of order!
Sweet Mercy! Without Ralph, we're doomed.
They’re gonna pull our plug!
(forced positivity) Okay everybody calm down. Ralph probably fell asleep in the washroom of Tapper’s again. Just then, a light approaches through the cord.
(relieved) See? There he is now. 30 The push-cart arrives, cranked by Q*Bert, not Ralph.
Why it’s Q*Bert. What brings you here, neighbor?
What’s he saying, Felix?
Stand by, my Q*Bertese is a little rusty. (in bad Q*Bertese)
(in bad Q*Bertese)
Ralph’s gone Turbo? RALPH'S STRAINED, GROWLING FACE.

Pull back to reveal, he’s still in Hero’s Duty. He’s forg the armor and he’s climbing the building. Ralph reaches the top. He peers in the window, A sea of eggs leads to a chamber in the middle Inside the chamber floats the Medal of Heroes.
Oooh, shiny. DOWN BELOW: Soldiers return to Start Position. sees: of the room.
Attention, the arcade is now closed.
Did you get a load of Markowski? Calhoun stops, squints, sniffs. She raises her hand, quie her troops.
Shut your chew holes. (to herself) Cy-bug. We hear a BLING. BLING. Felix steps out of the shadows. Calhoun reels around starts firing--
Taste it! Soldiers open fire on Felix, too. He springs into action, bouncing, dodging bullets and laser beams. BLING. BLING. Calhoun finally tackles him, straddles him and pins him d
Slick tiddly-winking, pint-size. She drives her gun’s muzzle into his face.
I’m Fix-It Felix Jr., ma’am, from the game Fix-It Felix, Jr. From the low angle, looking up at her. FELIX (CONT’D) Jiminy-jaminy.... Look at that high definition. Your face; it’s amazing!
Flattery don’t charge these batteries, civilian. She lets him up.
Now state your business.
Oh. I’m looking for my colleague, Wreck-It Ralph.
Never heard of him....
Well Q*Bert saw him come in here.
Impossible. Nothing gets past me. A CRASH is heard from above.

That came from the tower! They look and see Ralph’s shadow on the top floor made gi by the beacon light. ON THE TOP FLOOR OF THE LAB: Ralph punches the window, br it, and steps in. He does his most careful TIP-TOE across sea of eggs.
Nice little eggs... excuse me... He climbs the steps up to the chamber, triggering a giant hologram head to appear.
Congratulations soldier. It is my honor to bestow upon you the Medal of Heroes.

(in awe) Wow. The medal floats down to him. As it does, we see... RALPH'S PENTHOUSE PARTY — VISION -Ralph is on the dance floor surrounded by Nicelanders do the Wreck-it Ralph dance. -Mary wheels out a cake with a handsome Ralph on top, wea his Medal of Heroes and being hugged by the Nicelander figurines. -Gene is outside in the brick pile looking longingly up a the party through binoculars. He cries. BACK TO REALITY: The medal lands around Ralph’s neck.
No way. Ho-ho-ho. Wow!

Ten hut! History will long revere your courage and sacrifice. More holograms of space Colonels and Generals surround hi Heroic music plays. Ralph backs down the steps, smiling a waving to the holograms. GENERAL HOLOGRAM (CONT’D) You have etched in the rock of virtue, a legacy beyond compare.
Thank you. Thanks guys. At ease!
You are the universe’s greatest hero. CRACK! Ralph steps on an egg. SMASH! The egg shatters.
Oops. Aye-yai-yai. Ralph leans in for a closer look. The baby bug opens its cutely and then attacks. It attaches itself to Ralph’s fa

.--The living embodiment of all that this corps represents: Bravery, integrity, grace under pressure, and above all, dignity. RALPH (CONT’D) Ahhhhhmmmf fff! Ralph stumbles around, flies back and into one of the spa pods. A harness immediately locks him in place. The door slams shut.
Escape pod activated. The engine fires and then BOOM! The space pod bursts out the top of the building. INSIDE THE POD: Ralph struggles to pull the cy-bug off hi
(struggling) Get off my face! BACK OUTSIDE: The pod barrels down on Calhoun and Felix.
Incoming! The pod flies over the heads of Calhoun and Felix. As it passes by, Calhoun sees the cy-bug on Ralph’s face.
Cy-bug.
Ralph! The pods flies out of the game into tunnel to Game Centra
Ralph's pod blasts into the terminal, spiralling like an of-control bottle rocket off the floor and walls. Ralph t to pry the bug off of his face. POP! It lets go.
Ha ha! But then the bug starts to grow, fast.
Oh no! The space pod launches into the tunnel of another game. T blackness of the tunnel turns pink. Globs of pink goo col on the windshield. SHIP’S ROBOT VOICE Engine Failure. Engine Failure.
The space pod CRASH LANDS in...
It destroys a slice of countryside before stopping at the edge of a cliff. Ralph and the cy-bug slam against the da Something beeps. It’s the EJECT button!
Uh-oh. Whoaaaaaaaa!!! Ralph and the cy-bug catapult out of the ship. Ralph land the top of a tree. The cy-bug continues on and slams into nearby tree. It falls into a taffy pool and sinks as if d
Sayonara, sucker! From his vantage point Ralph can see a candy race track a bunch of dessert go-karts whizzing by. A giant sign glist SUGAR RUSH.
Sugar Rush? Oh no, this is that candy go-kart game over by the Whack-A-Mole. I got to get out of here. He wipes the stickiness off on his shirt and realizes tha his medal is gone.
No! No-no-no-no-no-NO! My medal! He spots the medal dangling from the highest branch of a peppermint tree. Ralph quickly climbs down the tree as it shakes from his weight.

THE MEDAL IN THE PEPPERMINT TREE — MOMENTS LATER The tree is surrounded by a bubbling taffy pool. Ralph teeters across some wobbly gum drops floating in the pool grabs the tree and climbs, eyes on the medal.
Hi mister!
He looks up, terrified. But it’s only VANELLOPE VON SCHWE a 9-year-old girl, looking down from a branch above him.
Hello!
Man! You scared me, kid! I nearly soiled myself!
What’s your name?
Ralph, Wreck-it Ralph.
You’re not from here, are you?
No, well, yeah, I mean not from right in this area. But I’m just doing some work here.
What kind of work? He continues climbing.
Some routine candy-tree trimming. You probably want to stand back. In fact, this whole area is technically closed while we’re trimmin’ so--
Who’s we?
Candy-tree department. He climbs higher.
Ah. Where is everybody else?
Oh, it’s just me, today.
So, you just meant like the royal we?
Yup. That’s right. Vanellope springs up to a branch by his face and hangs up down.
Are you a hobo?
No, I am not a hobo. But I am busy, so you go, go home.
He climbs
What’s that? I didn’t hear you. Your breath is so bad, it made my ears numb.
Listen, I try to be nice--
(mimicking him) I try to be nice.
You're mimicking me.
(still mimicking) You're mimicking me.
Okay, that is rude, and this conversation is over. on.
(still mimicking) That is rude and this conversation is....hahaha. (watching him) I wouldn't grab that branch if I were you. It’s a double stripe.
I’m from the candy-tree department. I know exactly-- He grabs the branch. DING! SNAP. Ralph Falls. RALPH (CONT’D)
He barely manages to catch a lower branch with one hand.
Double stripes break, ga-doi. Hey, why are your hands so freakishly big?
Uh, I dunno. Why are you so freakishly annoying?
Well, why are you so freakishly-- Just then, she notices the glistening medal.
Sweet mother of monkey milk! A gold coin!
Don’t even think about it. That is mine.
Race you for it! Vanellope moves like a monkey up the branches. Ralph foll
I don’t have to race you for it, because it’s mine. Grabs a double stripe. DING! It BREAKS!
Double stripe! Vanellope makes it to the top and grabs the medal.
Come back here! Give it back, give it, give it!

The winner! Whoa! Ralph grabs the branch she’s on and flings her off. She d the medal. He catches it. She dives for it, misses. Ralph lands on a double-stripe. DING! VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Double stripe! CRACK. He falls. The medal goes flying again.
Aahhh! Nooooooo! He grabs the bottom branch and hangs inches above the BUBBLING taffy. Vanellope snags the medal.
Thank you.
She hops off the tree to the ground, safely beyond the ta
Look, wait. Let me talk to you for one second. Here’s the thing, I’m not from the candy tree department.
Lying to a child. Shame on you, Ralph.
But I wasn’t lying about the medal. That is my medal. That’s why I was climbing the tree. It’s mine. It’s precious to me. Vanellope polishes the medal, admiring it.
That thing’s my ticket to a better life.
Yeah, well now it’s my ticket. Vanellope glitches.
What the...?
See ya, chump. She runs off.
Come back! I’11 find you! I will find you! Ralph hears a DING. He looks up. CRACK!
Double stripe! Ralph falls into the gooey taffy pool! He bubbles up, loo like a taffy beast.
Nowhere to hide! He disappears back beneath the sticky surface.
Surge Protector shows Felix and Calhoun the damaged entra to Sugar Rush.
Yeah, he banged around in here like some kind of hot shot. Then he went barreling down there into that sweet, little game like a crazy person. Calhoun studies the entrance to Sugar Rush.
Sugar Rush... (a steely Clint Eastwood- esque squint) Cy-Bugs‘1ll chew up that game faster than a chicken hawk in a coop of crippled roosters.
(following close behind) Uh. What was that now? She turns on him-- dead serious.
What’re you, thick? There was a Cy- Bug on that shuttle. (off his confused look) Do you even know what a Cy-Bug IS?
I can’t say that I do, ma’am.

(like talking to a child) Cy-Bugs are like a virus. They don’t know they’re in a game. All they know is eat, kill, multiply. Without a beacon to stop them, they’11l consume Sugar Rush. But do you think they’1l stop there?
Yes.
WRONG! Viruses do not stop! She stands up straight and majestic and looks over Game Central to all the tunnels leading to so many games.  WRECK-IT RALPH 4l

Once those Cy-Bugs finish off Sugar Rush, they'll invade every other game until this arcade is nothing but a smoking husk of forgotten dreams. (resolute) Kohut! My cruiser. Kohut hands her what looks like a folded surf board. Calh heads down the steps to the tunnel.
(to Kohut) Sheepers. Is she always this intense?
It’s not her fault. She’s programmed with the most tragic back story ever. The one day she didn’t do a perimeter check... her wedding day. Calhoun stares down the dark tunnel.

INT. CHURCH: Calhoun and an incredibly handsome soldier, BRAD, are about to exchange vows at the altar. Just then giant cy-bug crashes through the stained-glass window and CHOMPS down on the groom. Calhoun pulls out her automatic weapons and starts shooting through RAGING WAILS.
CALHOUN: She tries to shake it off. Felix hurries up to her in the tunnel.
Wait, Ma’am! I’m going with you!
Like fun you are, short stack. You die outside your game you don’t regenerate.
Well neither do you, ma’am. Now, it is my job to fix what Ralph wrecks. And I cannot ask you to risk your life cleaning up his mess. No flex (MORE )
on this one, ma‘am. I am coming along with you. She gives him a hard look, then scoots aside on her hover board, snaps, and points behind her on the board. He flip onto it. And off they go...
The stands are full. Racers zip up to the starting line i their go-karts. Bright royal music plays.
(flat, sad voice) Citizens of Sugar Rush... BENEATH THE STANDS: Vanellope sneaks up, pushing a tarp- covered kart. She peeks her head out, the Medal of Heroes clenched between her teeth.
Just in time!
.--all hail our rightful ruler, King Candy. Up in the tallest box, a curtain opens and KING CANDY -- his Ed-Wynn-like mug and style -- jumps out.
Hello my loyal subjects! Ha ha! Have some candy! King Candy throws handfuls of candy into the crowd.
Thank you for that stirring introduction, Sour Bill
Mmm hmm.
And thank you to today’s avatars. It was a wonderful day, it was. But now the arcade is closed, so it’s time to wipe the slate clean and race to decide our new roster. Huge cheers!
ON THE TRACK: We scan across the racers standing proud in their candy racing gear as King Candy explains the rules.
The first nine racers across that finish line will represent Sugar Rush as tomorrow’s Avatars.

Yes, okay. Calm down. Listen, this event is pay-to-play. We all know this. The fee to compete is one gold coin from your previous winnings; if you’ve ever won, which I have. Let me go first. King Candy pulls a lever and a rainbow sweeps across the starting line. King Candy throws his gold coin into the a It’s caught on a rainbow slide and swept into a giant pot King Candy’s name appears on a CONTESTANT board.

King Candy! King Candy leaps into the air with a flourish and poses. crowd goes wild! The first racer, a strawberry-pink, go-getter, tosses up coin. We follow it and watch it land in the pot, where it turns into game code and then disappears into an abyss.
Taffyta Muttonfudge! Taffyta does her signature leap and pose in the air and g the fans her catch-phrase.
Stay sweet! More kids throw in their coins as Vanellope pushes her covered kart to the starting line.
Adorabeezle Winterpop! Gloyd Orangeboar! Vanellope scurries up to the back of the line.
Crumbelina Di Caramello!
ON RALPH: Ralph, covered in taffy, trudges his way toward the race track.
Stealer. Catch that brat. BACK AT THE TRACK: Racers continue throwing their coins i the pot.

Minty Zaki! Snowanna Rainbeaux! Rancis Fluggerbutter! Jubileena Bing-Bing! Swizzle Malarkey! Candlehead! It’s Vanellope’s turn. She kisses the medal and throws it It’s caught by the rainbow, rims around the pot before dropping in. The pot glitches. The medal swirls inside it turns into game code, and disappears into the abyss.
(covering the mic) Sour Bill, who’s that last one? The board glitches and then a new racer appears on it: VANELLOPE VON SCHWEETZ. The crowd gasps in horror.
Vanellope Von Schweetz!
Yippee! I’m in the race!
Vanellope?! Taffyta rips the tarp off of Vanellope’s kart, revealing sad kart made from recycled junk with the name “Lickity Split” written on the side.
The glitch! The crowd starts to panic.
Now, now. Everything is all right. (panicking) Security! Two donut cops, WYNNCHEL and DUNCAN, come running in.
Come here, kid.
We're not going to hurt you, you little freak. Vanellope makes a break for it.
Get back here!
Slow down! Just then a taffy-covered Ralph -- twigs and candy stuck him -- comes barrelling onto the track, looking like a creature from the taffy lagoon.
(pointing at her) YOU! Give me back my medal right now.
Oh boy.
What is that? Ralph chases Vanellope.
Get back here. Vanellope slips under a spectator’s box. Ralph lifts up t box, revealing her.
Nowhere to hide!
Whoa! She scurries back under the next box. Ralph follows her, tipping box after box. Spectators scat
Get out of my way!
Careful! What are you doing?! Vanellope runs out from under then stands. Ralph follows. slams into a giant cupcake, water tower. It tips.
np rooktng up) Huh? The giant cupcake falls onto him. His taffy-covered head out the top. He tips over.
Can't move.
Now we got him. The donut cops rush up to a helpless Ralph -- who points where Vanellope went and mumble-yells.

head_text.subj: OH GOOD, THE COPS. SHE WEN DAAAWAY

text: They ignore him and knock him with their batons.
Hold still.
Take that.
Hmmmmay! What’re you doing?!
(into his microphone) Okay folks. Calm down! Everything's all right. The monster's been caught. We’ll repair all the damage. Don’t worry, we will have our race before the arcade opens.
And I’m in it. Vanellope hops into her kart and pedals off.
(to the other racers) There’s no way that I am racing with a glitch. Rancis, Candlehead, come on. She and the racers hop in their cars and drive off.
Sour Bill, that glitch cannot be allowed to race. (MORE )
(point down to Ralph) And bring that THING to my castle. Wynnchel switches to using a taser on Ralph.
She took my me-- Aaaahhhhhh!!!
EXT. KING’S CANDY CASTLE OREO GUARDS march and chant outside a grand candy palace.

(chanting) O-re-o. O-ree-o. O-re-o. O-ree-o. INT. KING’S CANDY CASTLE The donut police roll the Ralph cupcake/taffy ball into a frilly throne room. King Candy drives his kart right into room and backs it into his THRONE parking spot.
Sour Bill, de-taffify this monster so we can see what we’re up against here.
Mmmm-kay. Sour Bill pulls off a giant glob of taffy, exposing Ralph face and head.
Waaahhhhhh!
Milk my duds, it’s Wreck-it Ralph?!
(getting his bearings) Yeah. Who are you, the guy that makes the donuts?
Please. No, I’m King Candy.
I see you’re a fan of pink.
Salmon. Salmon. That’s obviously sal-- What are you doing here?
Look, you're candiness, this is just a big misunderstanding. Just get me out of this cupcake, I’‘1l get my medal, and I’1l be outta your way.
YOUR medal? Bad guys don’t win medals.
Well, this one did. I earned it over in Hero’s Duty.
You game-jumped? Ralph, you’re not going Turbo are you?
What? No, no no.
Because if you think you can come in here to my kingdom and take over my game, you’ve got another thing coming.
Easy your puffiness. It’s not my fault one of your children of the candy corn stole my medal!
Children of the candy corn? Who? (realizing, GASP) The glitch! The coin she used to buy her way into the race, that was your medal?
She did what...? I need that back!
Well, I’m afraid I can’t help you. It’s gone, it’s nothing but code now. And it’1ll stay that way until someone wins the cup at the end of the race.
Well, maybe I’11 just have to have a little talk with the winner then.
Is that a threat I smell-- beyond the halitosis you so obviously suffer from?
Listen Nillie Wafer, I’m not leaving without my medal.
Yes, you are. Wynnchel, Duncan, get him out of that cupcake and on the first train back home. And if I ever see you here again, Wreck-it Ralph, I‘’1l lock you in my fungeon.
Fungeon?

Fun Dungeon. It’s a play on words.... Nevermind. Now, I’ve got a glitch to deal with, thanks to you. Goodbye Wreck-it Ralph. It hasn’t been a pleasure. King Candy hops into his kart and drives out of the room. Wynnchel knocks on the cupcake.
This thing’s hard as a rock.
I can see that. Get the tools.
What tools? Wynnchel hits Ralph with the baton.
Quiet, you. Duncan goes over to a chest, pulls out a chain-saw, and r it up.
What? No! Ah! Stay away from me!
Hey, take it easy, big boy. Ralph flails. He rolls back onto his feet and starts hobb towards the door.
He’s getting away! The Oreo guards block his way, shouting “Oreo.” He turns eyes two giant windows.
Ralph and the cupcake burst through the wall and fall.
Wynnchel and Duncan run to the window. They look down and the smashed cupcake on the ground and Ralph running away.
Quick, call out the devil dogs.

DEVIL DOGS on leashes bound through the trees and down th ravine. They stop by a chocolate stream. They lose the sc and run off down river. A pixie stick, poking out of the stream, moves. Ralph bre the surface.
Argh... I hate chocolate. (scrambling to the shore) Got to get my medal back. He hears the ROAR of engines. Sees a bunch of racers spee on nearby road.
The pot goes to the winning racer. He runs after them.

Hey, kids! Can I talk to you for a second? He just misses them, as they disappear around the bend an approach Vanellope, who is working on her handmade kart. up on a jacks. The racers sweep in and surround her. She pushes away any evidence of fear and stands tall to meet them.
Hello, fellow racers! Ralph peeks over the hill.
It’s that little crumbsnatcher.
Taffyta, Rancis, you’re looking well. Came by to check out the competition, huh? Well, here it is, The Lickity Split. unimpressed.
Jeesh. Looks like she built it herself. BACK ON THE KIDS: Taffyta gets out of her kart and approa Vanellope.
Built it myself. Fastest pedal- power west of the Whack-A-Mole. Check her out. Vanellope hops in her kart and starts pedalling. The gear catch and spin.
Oh, Vanellope, it’s so...you. But you have to back out of the race, yeah. Vanellope gets out of her kart and approaches Taffyta.
Oh, no I don’t, because I paid my fee. I’m on the board. So, yeah, I’m definitely racing.
Well, King Candy says glitches can’t race.
I’m not a glitch, Taffyta. (she glitches) I've just got Pixlexia, okay? Ignoring her, Taffyta walks over to Vanellope’s kart.

The rules are there for a reason, Vanellope. To protect us. (getting in Vanellope’s kart) Say I’m you. I’m in my weird little car, and I’m driving, and I actually feel kinda cool for once. And then, all of a sudden, oh no! I'm gl-gl-gl-gl-itching! Taffyta shudders and then rips the steering wheel right o
Hey!
See? You're an accident just waiting to happen.

Oh no, I glitched, too. Jubileena goes over to the kart, flails and crashes into ripping off the brake. Vanellope rushes over to her kart, other racers get in her way and block her. ON RALPH: Disturbed by what he’s seeing.
Uncool. BACK ON THE KIDS: The other racers tear apart the kart.
Oh no, I glitched. I glitched. Look out, I’m glitching.
Stop. You’re breaking it! No! Please. Vanellope grabs Taffyta and spins her around to face her.
VANELLOPE (CONT’D) I just want to race like you guys.

You'll never be a racer, because you're a glitch...and that’s all you'll ever be. Taffyta pushes Vanellope, who goes flying back, and lands SPLAT in the mud. ON RALPH: That’s the last straw; he jumps up.
Hey! Leave her alone! He runs down the hill, flails his arms, and throws mud at kids. They SCREAM in terror.
Scram, you rotten little cavities, before I throw YOU in the mud! The racers drive off. Ralph puffs up. He turns to Vanello She wipes away tears, while sifting through the wreckage her kart.
What are YOU looking at?
You're welcome, you rotten little thief.
I’m not a thief. I just borrowed your stupid coin. I was gonna give it back to you as soon as I won the race.
It’s not a coin. It is a medal.
Coin. Medal. Just go back to your own dumb game and win another one.
I can’t. I didn’t win it in my game. I won it in Hero’s Duty.
Hero’s Doodie?! Ha!
It’s not that kind of duty.
I bet you really gotta watch where you step in a game called Hero’s Doodie. What did you win a medal for? Wiping? I hope you washed your hands after you handled that medal.
Listen.
Wait. One more. One more: why did the hero flush the toilet? VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Say why...
Why.
Because it was his doodie.
How dare you insult Hero's Duty, you little guttersnipe! I earned that medal, and you better get it back for me, toot-sweet, sister!

Well, unless you’ve got a go-kart hidden in the fat folds of your neck, I can’t help you. Ralph makes like he wants to crush her, but forces himsel smash a nearby candy tree instead. He then punches a gian jawbreaker. It doesn’t so much as crack. He tries again. Nothing. Incensed, he pounds on it-- temper-tantrum style VANELLOPE (CONT’D) What a moron. (calling to Ralph) Hey genius, it’s a jawbreaker! You’re never gonna break-- (as he breaks it) ..-that...? That gives her an idea.
Hmmm.
Ralph plops down on a rock, out of breath. Vanellope come over and leans against a nearby jawbreaker. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Enjoy your little tantrum, diaper baby?
Leave me alone.
Look, you want that medal, right? And I want to race. So, here’s what I'm thinking; you help me get a new kart, a real kart, and I’1l win the race and get you back your medal.
You want me to help you?
All you got to do is break something for me. Come on, what do you say, friend? She holds out a hand. He doesn’t take it right away.
We are not friends.
Ah come on, pal. You son of a gun. Come on buddy, let’s shake on it. Come on chumbo. Ralph, my man. My main man. Hey, my arm’s getting tired. We have a deal or not?
You better win. He takes her little hand, and they shake on it.
Felix and Calhoun get a bird’s eye view of Ralph’s wrecka
I'll say this much, they don’t call your friend Wreck-It for nothing. There’s the shuttle!
She lands the cruiser.
Calhoun does a military run up to the ship, gun raised. S circles it, checks the cockpit. Felix approaches cautiously.
Is he in there?
Nope. Lucky for him, otherwise I would have slapped his corpse.... No cy-bug either. She pulls out her tri-quarter bug sensor and starts scann
Got to find it before it lays its filthy eggs.
Calhoun and Felix pass the pit. She’s getting a faint sig on the sensor. It scrambles. She smacks it. It scrambles more.
(with disgust) Argh. This atmosphere is full of sugar particles, and it’s jamming my Sensor with funny fudge. They walk on.
So, what is it with this Wreck-it joker? Why’d he go AWOL?
I wish I knew, ma’am. He was acting all squirrelly last night-- going on about cake and medals. (distraught) But I never thought he’d go Turbo.
Go Turbo...?
That's right, guys just got plugged in. Well, back when the arcade first opened...

INT. LITWAK’S ARCADE, EARLY 80S - FLASHBACK Simpler days. 80s music. 80s kids play classic games -- F PAC MAN, and an 8-bit racing game called TURBO TIME. We m TURBO -- basically a giant smiley face in a generic car, racing on a generic road.
«+. Turbo Time was by far the most popular game. Turbo crosses the finish line and gives us a giant thumbs

And Turbo-- well, he loved the attention. Turbo takes the first-place spot on a podium. He blocks t second-place racer down with a wave of his trophy and blo the third-place racer from view with his Turbo thumbs-up.

So when RoadBlasters got plugged in and stole Turbo’s thunder, boy was he jealous... RoadBlasters is wheeled in. Kids abandon Turbo Time to pl it. TURBO is left mid-game. He stops and looks across the arcade to Pole Position. His big smile turns to a frown.
So jealous that abandoned his game... POWER STRIP: We watch the little Turbo dots cross the pow cord from his game to RoadBlasters.
-..and tried to take over the new one. ROADBLASTERS — SHORT TIME LATER
A frustrated kid tries to play RoadBlasters, but the scre is in chaos -- an 8-bit Turbo glitches all over the track causing the kid to crash his car.
Is that-- that looks like Turbo!
Aw what’s Turbo doing in this game? (crashing) Aw c’mon!
Mr. Litwak!
Turbo ended up putting both games and himself out of order, for good. A WORKER wheels out both Turbo Time and Pole Position. BACK ON CALHOUN AND FELIX: Calhoun shakes her head.
The selfish man is like a mangy dog chasing a cautionary tale. They step onto a fallen peppermint tree acting as a bridg over a ravine.
I know, right? That's why I have to get Ralph home, or the same thing’s gonna happen to my game. DING! DING! The entire tree is double stripe. It blinks.
Huh? The tree disappears. They fall into a pit of chocolate powder.
What is this? A sign reads: NESQUIK SAND.
Nesquik Sand? They start sinking. Felix panics.

Quik sand?! I’11 hop out and grab you one of those vines! Calhoun stands calm, sizing up the situation. Felix flail he tries to hop out of the sand. But his usual “boing” is more like a “bllllrgh” as the sand swallows him.
I can’t hop. I’m hopless! This is hopeless! We’re gonna drown here!
Stop thrashing! Stop moving-- you're making us sink faster! He’s still panicking. Calhoun slaps him in the face.
Get a hold of yourself. He looks at her, shocked. Suddenly they hear GIGGLING. Th look up to see Laffy Taffy vines hanging from a tree. As vines giggle, they stretch and lower towards them.
Those vines. They’re Laffy Taffy. They’re attracted to whatever makes them laugh. Here, hit me again. She smacks him, lightly. The taffy vines retreat, disappointed.
That’s not funny enough. Harder. She hesitates.
Look, you're a nice guy, I can’t--
(unusually forceful) No, ma’‘am! The arcade is depending on us. Now do your duty, that’s an order! She full on belts him. The taffy howls with laughter. He’ got a huge back eye.
Owwww! It’s working, hit me again!
Ooh, your eye.
I can fix it. He hits his eye with the hammer. His black eye goes away.
Now go-- ow! San Frantastic. WHAP! The vines howl. Felix smiles at her. He’s got teeth missing. He hammers his teeth. BLING! His teeth reappear.
Again! Ow! You mean business! Ow! Yikes on bikes! She hits. BLING. He fixes his face. She hits. BLING. He f his face. She hits. Bling. He fixes.
We're... killing... them... Finally, the vines are within reach. He grabs hold, then pulls her into his arms.

Hold on tight, m’lady. The vine sweeps them up and out of the quicksand. The wor slows down. Music swells. Calhoun looks up at Felix. For reason he looks strong-jawed and heroic. He smiles down o her. Man, she’s beautiful. There’s a real chemistry betwe them. They arrive on the tree branch. Calhoun notices that the Laffy Taffy are singing in a Dis esque choir and have formed a heart shape around them. Sh pulls out her gun and shoots at the vines.
Alright, enough with the goo-goo eyes. She looks at the sensor, all business.
(climbing out of the tree) Argh, we lost the cy-bug. Let’s go. Come on, we’ll get a better view from the air. Think you can fix that shuttle?

Can do. He follows back her towards the shuttle. Down below the tree, unbeknownst to them, something has burrowed into the ground. We recognize the sounds of a cy coming from the hole it made. We see a Cy Bug emerge from the hole. It eats a candy can and becomes striped.

An impressive facility shaped like a giant cake. Birthday candle chimneys line the top. Ralph and Vanellope sneak p a guard's booth with BEARD PAPA snoozing inside of it. EXT. BAKERY WALL — MOMENTS LATER They slink up to a giant door with a hefty dead-bolt on i Vanellope’s face is painted huge on the door with a circl slash through it and the words: “No Glitches Allowed!”
Alright, do your thing, knuckles. Bust it open.
What’s this? You are a full on criminal, aren’t you?
Hey, we shook on it.
Ralph's fist busts through the door, destroying it.
Thank you, Jeeves. Vanellope runs in. It’s dark. There’s nothing but a start button.
What is this place? Where are the karts? She hits the START BUTTON. A screen lights up. It reads: CHOOSE YOUR KART. There are a bunch of cool candy karts t choose from.
We gotta make one.
What? No, no no. Look, kid, bad idea, trust me. I don’t make things, I break things.

Looks like you'll be stepping outside your comfort zone then, Gladys. (seeing a kart she likes) Ooh, this is a good one. She presses the “choose” button. Suddenly the entire plac lights up. There are levers and pulleys and bins.
Welcome to the BAKERY. Let’s bake a kart.
What is this, another game?
Yeah, well, it’s a mini game.
You have one minute to win it.
What?
Come on, Ralph!
Go! Oversized numbers fly through air from the background to foreground. Vanellope runs over to giant steering wheel. Before her: shoots, a balancing platform, a bowl, and a trash can.
The word “MIXING” flies through the air and knocks Ralph the head.

Put the ingredients in the bowl and throw away the trash. Vanellope hangs on the wheel to steer it. Egg come out of shoot and onto the platform. She steers the wheel. The platform tilts to drop the eggs in the batter bowl. Other objects come out of the shoots like boots, soccer balls, underpants, and hairbrushes. A recipe card keeps score. Vanellope’s having trouble wit the steering and is missing the ingredients.
Hair brush, no. Underpants. No, no! (frustrated) You're getting it all wrong, kid!
I’m trying! The clock reads: 45 seconds.
Urgh. I’11 do it. He jumps up on the platform, catches all the ingredients, throws the good ones into the bowl and the bad ones all o the floor.
No... yes... gross.. Milk, yes, yes! The flour hits him. He falls into the batter. The beaters comes down and mix the batter, Ralph and all.
Batter up! The batter and Ralph dump into a mold. Ralph crawls out o the batter just before it goes into the oven.
Come on, no sleeping on the job.
Baking! Ralph gets up, stumbles around, dizzy. The word “BAKING” flies through the air and clocks him. UMPH.
Pump up the heat and hold the perfect temperature. Vanellope runs over and jumps on the bellows. She can’t g it hot enough.
Ralph! A little help here.
I’m on it! Ralph jumps on it. He completely breaks the bellows.
Ralph!
Yeah, no problem, just give me this thing here-- Ralph grabs the hose and blows into it himself. The mercu rises.

Okay, good! A little more. That’s it! Hold it! Hold it! Hold it! His cheeks are bulging. He turns red...then purple...then blue. DING! Vanellope cheers. Ralph collapses. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Yes! Come on, get up, Ralph! Fifteen seconds! The door opens. The kart slides onto a conveyor belt.
Ralph manages to duck under the “DECORATING” word. The conveyor belt goes under a bunch of candy dispensers filled with everything from wheels to jimmies. They must
launch eggs off of a spatula aimed at targets on the respective bins.
Wheels first.
How many?
FOUR, doi!
Got it. Ralph hits the spatula four times hard. Four eggs launch, the target and four wheels pop out of the bin.
Now frosting. A buttload of frosting!

No problem. He hits the spatula several times. Several eggs go flying smash the entire bin, which dumps all of its frosting ont the kart. Then the entire bin tips, knocks the next bin. The bins collapse like dominoes and dump all the ingredients down the kart.
Uh oh. The final buzzer sounds. The kart drops down a ramp into a fancy garage.
Times up. They run to the garage door, on which there’s a beautiful image of a perfect kart. The garage door opens, revealing their abomination beneath it.
Congratulations. You did it. And here’s your kart! Vanellope stares wide-eyed at the kart,.
Aye yi yi. Look, kid...I tried to warn you, I can’t make things, I just break--
I love it!
You do?

I love it. I LOVE IT! I LOVE IT! Look, it’s got a real engine, and look at these wheels. (kisses the wheels) I love it! I finally have a real kart! She hugs the kart. Ralph grins, pleased. Vanellope then grabs two small pastry bags. VANELLOPE (CONT ’D) Come on. A work of art like this must be signed. BACK OUTSIDE: Beard Papa wakes with a start. He sees Vanellope on the security camera. Beard Papa GASP He grabs his Red emergency phone.

This is Beard Papa. The glitch is in the bakery! Get me King Candy. cur TO: BACK INSIDE THE BAKERY: Ralph and Vanellope finish puttin their names on the kart and stand back to admire their wo Ralph’s smiling like a sap-- the first we've seen him smi
Whoa. You have teeth? I’ve never seen you smile before.
I’m not smiling. I’m gassy, okay? They start to crack up, when:
Hold it right there, glitch!
King Candy, Wynnchel, and Duncan drive in. King Candy see Ralph and GASPS in shock!
(seeing Ralph) And Wreck-it Ralph?!
Uh-oh. Ralph aims the pastry bag at King Candy and the donuts an sprays them in the face, temporarily blinding them.
Start the kart! Ralph throws Vanellope in the driver’s seat of her kart a hops on the back.
Start the kart.... She fiddles with the buttons and knobs but nothing happen
What are you waiting for?! C’mon, let’s go?!
I... ah. I don’t know how to drive a real kart.
You don’t what?! Duncan looks at King Candy, concerned.
Are you hurt, Sire?
No, he just glazed me! Get them! Ralph pushes off the floor with his hands. The kart takes off.
Gang way!
EXT. BAKERY — CONTINUOUS Ralph and Vanellope burst right through the wall. Ralph h pedals the ground faster. They catch a downhill and pick speed. King Candy and the donuts are hot on their trail.
Stop in the name of the king, that’s me!

Get off the road! Ralph digs into the ground and takes a tight turn. The CL swat truck over-shoots and goes tumbling. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Head for Diet Cola Mountain! They take a fork in the road. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Drive into the wall!
What?!
Right there, between the two sugar- free lollipops!
Are you crazy?!
Just do it! Ralph aims the kart at the mountain head on! And just as brace for impact, Ralph, Vanellope, and the kart hit the mountain wall, pixelate, and disappear.
Ralph and Vanellope come sweeping into a Dali-esque world half-built game props. They CRASH. The kart ends up verti against a rock, front wheels spinning.
King Candy and the donut police screech to a halt. King C removes his goggles and looks around.
Where'd they go? Find that glitch. Destroy that kart. She can’t be allowed to race. Wynnchel and Duncan drive off. King Candy wipes his sweat brow, upset.
Ralph picks himself up and lays into Vanellope.
Let me get this straight; you don’t know how to drive.
Well no, not technically. But I just thought-- Ralph gets to his feet.
What did you think?! (mocking voice) Oh, I'll just magically win the race just because I really want to! She grabs the steering wheel, eager.
Look wise guy, I know I’m a racer. I can feel it in my code.
That's it, I’m never getting my medal back. Vanellope jumps up and tries to push the kart off the roc It doesn’t budge.
What is the big whoop about that crummy medal anyway?
The big whoop? Well this may come as a shock to you, but in my game, I’m the bad guy, and I live in the garbage.
Cool.

No, not cool. Unhygienic. And lonely. And boring. But that “crummy medal” was gonna change all that. I go home with that baby around my neck, and I'll get a penthouse. Pies. Ice sculptures. Fireworks... (off her blank stare) ..-Ah, it’s grown up stuff. You wouldn’t understand.
No, I get it. That’s exactly what racing would do for me. She goes back to trying to push the kart off the rock.
Well, guess what?
What?
News flash! Neither one of us is getting what we want. Ralph stomps his foot. BOOM! Something explodes nearby.
What was that? Ralph follows the sound. He comes to a room with a bubbling pool. He reads the sig
(reading) “Diet cola hot springs. Watch out for falling Mentos?”

Yeah, check it out. Look! Vanellope throws a rock at the stalactite. Hits it. A pie of Mentos falls into the pool. BOOM! A giant broiling gey shoots up into the air. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Oh, you gotta watch out for the splash. That stuff’s broiling hot.
Yeah, I got that, thank you. What is this dump?

I think it’s some sort of unfinished bonus level. Yeah, it’s pretty cool, huh? I found that secret opening, and now I live here. See, look, look look! She runs over to a crudely fashioned lean-to above a bed candy-wrappers. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Welcome to my home! I sleep in these candy wrappers. I bundle myself up like a little homeless lady... Suddenly, it occurs to Ralph: their plights are the same.
By yourself, with all this garbage around you?
Well, yeah. I mean everyone here says I’m just a mistake, and that I wasn’t even supposed to exist. What do you expect?
Listen, kid... I know it’s none of my business, but why do you even stick around this game?

You really don’t know anything, do you? Glitches can’t leave their games. It’s one of the joys of being me. Ralph looks around at her sad life. He gets a thought. He raises his giant fist and starts pounding the twisted, nonsense architecture. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Hey! What are you doing?! Come on! I know it’s a dump, but it’s all I got!
(still pounding) If you’re going to be a racer, you have to learn how to drive, and you can’t do that without a track. REVEAL: He’s made a beginner’s track around the hot sprin
Whoa. Ralph picks up the kart and puts it on the track.
Alright now, let’s hustle up. We got some driving to do. Vanellope runs in a circle around Ralph and the kart, cheering.
I’m gonna learn to drive! I’m gonna learn to drive! I’m gonna--Wait. Do you know how to drive?
Yeah! I mean, I haven’t done it, but look, I flew a spaceship today, okay?
You crashed it.
Just get in. How hard can it be? Okay, uh... start it up. Vanellope starts it up and revs the engine.
There you go. Okay, now--
There’s so much stuff in here!
Don’t start touching anything yet. Vanellope touches everything. She turns on the lights.
What’s this?
Them’s the lights.
And what’s this? She hits the horn, holds.
That’s the horn. Yeah, that’s still the horn.
I like the horn.
Listen, we got work to do!
Okay! She stops, focuses on him. He points to the pedals.
So there’s some buttons on the floor...
Pedals!

Pedals. Right. Now, that’s the Go pedal. That, I believe is the stopper. And this.... Wait. What is this? (pressing the clutch) It doesn't do anything. He picks up the kart, looks closely at the pedals, and st playing with them.
What does this joystick do? She pushes the gear shift. The kart jumps forward, draggi Ralph with it. He lands flat on his face.
Vanellope stalls. Ralph lifts his head up.
Good. Let’s try that again.
RALPH: standing in front of her. She zips forward and slams into Ralph.
RALPH: standing behind her. She grinds the gears, flies in reverse, slams into him. H cries out. She slams into him again.
RALPH: hiding behind a rock. Vanellope bucks forward, hits a tree. The tree falls, lan on Ralph’s head.
VANELLOPE: steering through an obstacle course. CUT to re Ralph is pushing the kart from behind, guiding her around rocks.
RALPH: motion-steering as Vanellope watches. She turns th wheel and slams into a rock. Spitting out a tooth, she gi a “thumbs up.”
VANELLOPE: driving in first gear. She lifts her foot off clutch slowly and moves forward smoothly.
Hey, wait, you’re doing it. She shifts again.
Oh, I am.
Okay. Shift it again.
She makes it around the track. Shifts perfectly.
Whoa! I told you; racing’s in my code! She drives faster...and faster.
Whoa, whoa whoa! Eyes on the wheel!
Hey Ralphie, watch this! I’m going off road! She jumps the track then drives right up a steep, natural ramp. She jumps a part of broken track. Lands perfectly. She makes another jump. Perfect.
I got that medal in the bag. She then aims for a giant jump...takes flight and....GLIT Her kart glitches about in the air, out of control. She’s headed right for the stalactite. She SCREAMS!

Look out! She ducks, but her spoiler hits the Mentos. She glitches again and crash lands on the track on the other side. Giant chunks of Mentos fall into the hot springs. Geysers shoot up. Ralph jumps out of the way of the boiling cola falling around him. Vanellope keeps spins out of control. She skids to a stop She looks spooked, but then she shakes it off.
So, how'd I do?
Um... well, you almost blew up the whole mountain.
Right, right, that’s a good note.
You've got to get that glitch under control, kid!
Okay, I will, I will! And then you think I got a chance? He contemplates.
...Tiny. She jumps up and around Ralph shouting--
Yes! I’m gonna win! I’m gonna win! I’m gonna win! I’m gonna win!
(giving in to her enthusiasm) Top shelf.
Top shelf! They fist bump.
INT. KING CANDY’S CASTLE King Candy paces in front of his kart throne. Sour Bill follows, waving him with a fan lollipop. The castle doors open. Wynnchel and Duncan approach.
(urgent) Did you find her? Tell me you found her. The donut cops shake their heads, no, solemnly.
You didn’t? Go... leave me. The donuts leave. King Candy thinks, gets an idea, then storms off through door by his throne. Sour Bill hurries after him.

INT. “UNDERGROUND” CHAMBER An elevator door opens and King Candy and Sour Bill step and walk along what looks like the insides of a wire. King Candy approaches a large door, upon which rests a ga controller. He types in a cheat code. The door swings ope King candy steps through it. INT. THE GAME’S CODE For the code savvy, it’s clearly a node graph. To the res us it looks like an electric spider web of glowing thread connecting an endless number of vault-like boxes.

Oh the code, the sweet life blood of the game. The boxes are labelled with icons and text, saying everyt from: “GOBSTOPPER VALLEY” and “CHOCOLATE RIVER” to “TAFFY MUTTONFUDGE” and “SOUR BILL.” The physics are different here, and so King Candy floats if in zero gravity. He drifts amongst the web, cautiously

Where are you? Let’s see.... Stadium.... Jumbotron. There it is the “Winner’s Cup.” He double-clicks the box labeled “WINNER’S CUP.” The box opens. Inside floats a bunch of smaller boxes labeled “Co interconnected with threads. Amongst the boxes, one stand out. Its label says, “MEDAL.”

One of these things is not like the others. You! We’re going to give you a nice new home. King Candy slides the Medal box out of the Winner’s Box a along the network of threads. He arrives in front of a ve special box, connected with the most number of threads. I labeled, “KING CANDY.” He double clicks it. It opens and slides the “Medal” box inside. A string of ones and zeros gathers around his neck, then solidifies into The Medal of Heroes.
Success.

He floats back towards the door. On his way he passes by box that is off alone, with no threads attached. It glitc Its label says: “VANELLOPE VON SCHWEETZ.” KING CANDY (0.S.) (CONT’D) Sour Bill, I’m going out. You’re in charge of the castle until I get back.
The cy-bug sensor is locked on the dash, scanning. There no bugs detected. Calhoun pilots. Felix stares at her, blushing-- unapologetically smitten.
Your face is still red, you might want to hit it with your hammer.
Oh that’s not blunt force trauma, ma’am. That’s just the honey glow in my cheeks.
Oh.
Ma’am, I just gotta tell you...You’re one dynamite gal. Calhoun reacts. FLASHBACK: Calhoun at the gun range, letting out a round. BRAD in the cubicle next to her, turns, impressed.
Wow, you are one dynamite gal. FLASHBACK: Calhoun and Brad, sharing a Sunday.
One dynamite gal. FLASHBACK: Calhoun and Brad having a flowery picnic.
Dynamite gal.
FLASHBACK: Brad on one knee proposing.
Dynamite gal. FLASHBACK: Calhoun and Brad’s wedding.
Dynamite gal. The glass shatters as the bug bursts in.
INT. SHIP — DAY, BACK TO PRESENT Calhoun snaps back to reality, upset, almost livid. She b the ship hard to the right. Felix goes tumbling. She lands the ship in the woods by the castle.
Get out!
All I said is you're a dynamite gal!
I said GET OUT! He climbs out. Turns to say something else, but the glass comes down immediately and the ship lifts off.
(distraught) Jimminy jamminy... He lumbers off towards the castle.
EXT. KING CANDY’S CASTLE DOOR — SHORT TIME LATER Felix knocks on the castle door. Sour Bill opens the door
Mmmmyes?
I’m Fix-it Felix, Jr, sir, from the game Fix-it Felix Jr. Have you seen my friend, Ralph?
Wreck-it Ralph?
Yes, yes, that’s him.
Shoulda locked him up when we had the chance.
Locked him up? Sour Bill grabs a handle and pulls. A trap door opens and Felix falls in.
Not making the same mistake with you.
(falling) Oh my land!
Vanellope comes running out of the secret door. Ralph pus the kart out behind her.

Come on Ralph! This is it. This is really happening. I almost don’t believe it. I mean, I have dreamt about it for so long, and now...now I think I’m gonna puke, actually. I mean I think I might puke. You know, like a verp?
A what?
Vomit and a burp together, and you can taste it, and it’s just like rising up.... Oh this is so exciting!
Yes! It is. It’s exciting!
I mean, am I ready to be a real racer? Ralph, what if the gamers don’t like me?!
Who doesn’t love a brat with dirty hair? Come on, those people are gonna love you. You know why? Because you’re a winner.
I’m a winner.
And you're adorable.
I’m adorable.
And everyone loves an adorable winner!
Yeah!
Okay. Come on. She laughs and hops in her kart. Ralph climbs on the back
Listen to me: if you get nervous, just keep telling yourself: “I must win Ralph’s medal or his life will be ruined.” And have fun. Got it?
Got it. Vanellope starts driving away, then slams on the brakes. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Wait. Hold on! Ralph FALLS forward. She puts it in reverse, then stops short. He FALLS off the back.
Where are you going?
I forgot something. I’1l be right back. Vanellope runs back into the mountain. Ralph watches afte her.
Huh. kids...! He sighs, content. We hear the sound of a kart engine.
Ralph, there you are! Hello! Ralph turns to see King Candy getting out of his kart.
You!
Now, I came alone. Unarmed. Whoa-- He ducks as a boulder flies past his head.
I’ve had enough of you, Pillow Pants. Ralph chases King Candy around a giant gum drop.
Now, calm down! Calm down!
I’m gonna beat the filling out of you!
(putting on giant glasses) You wouldn't hit a guy with glasses, would you? Ralph grabs the glasses off of his face and knocks King C on the head with them.
Oh you hit a guy WITH glasses, well played. Ralph grabs him by the lapels.
What do you want, Candy?
For you to close your mouth. Your breath... Listen, I just want to talk to you.
I’m not interested in anything you have to say.
How about this? Are you interested in this? King Candy holds up the Medal of Heroes. Shocked to see i Ralph drops King Candy.
My medal. How did you--
It doesn’t matter. It’s yours.... Go ahead. Take it. Ralph takes the medal.
All I ask is that you hear me out. Ralph stares at the medal as he considers.
.--About what?
Ralph, do you know what the hardest part about being a King is? Doing what’s right, no matter what.
Get to the point.
Point being, I need your help. Sad as it is, Vanellope cannot be allowed to race.
Why are you people so against her?
I’m not against her. I’m trying to protect her.

If Vanellope wins that race, she’1l be added to the Race Roster. We close in on King Candy’s eye and into his mind, where see Vanellope pop up as one of the nine daily avatars. A gamer selects Vanellope.
Then gamers can choose her as their avatar. And when they see her glitching and twitching and just being herself... FLASH FORWARD: Vanellope glitching all over the track.
...they’11 think our game is broken. We’1ll be put out of order, for good. FLASH FORWARD: The Out-of-Order gets slapped onto the Sug Rush console. King Candy’s subjects rush into Game Central.
All my subjects will be homeless. But there’s one who cannot escape, because she’s a glitch. FLASH FORWARD: A scared Vanellope is sucked into the vort of un-plugged oblivion.
Help! Somebody help!
And when the game’s plug is pulled, she'll die with it. We pull out of the FLASH FORWARD through Ralph’s eyes. He horrified by the thought.
You don’t know that’ll happen. The gamers could love her.
And if they don’t? Ralph sits down, eyes still on his medal.

I know it’s tough. But heroes have to make the tough choices, don’t they? She can’t race, Ralph. But she won’t listen to me. So, can I count on you to talk a little sense into her? Ralph contemplates, then gives a small, pained nod.

Very good.... Now, I’1ll give you two some time alone. King Candy disappears around the bend. Ralph stares at th medal. He hears Vanellope returning. He stands, braces himself, and puts the medal in his pocket.
I'm back. Did you miss me?
Yeah. Yeah. Hey, can we talk for a second?
Wait. First, kneel down.
What? No, no, we really--
Will ya just do it!
Ok. He kneels down.
Now close your eyes.
Vanellope.
Shush. Close ‘em! He shuts them. She ties something around his neck. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Okay. Open ‘em up!
He looks down and sees a small, handmade candy heart on a string, on which is hand-painted the words: “To Stink Bra
(reading) To Stink Brain. Gee, thanks.

Turn it over. He does. On the back is painted the words: “You’re my Her VANELLOPE (CONT’D) I made it for you, just in case we don’t win. Not that I think there's even a remote chance we’re not gonna win.
(this is killing him) Thanks kid, Um listen--
Now rise, my royal chump! I’ve got a date with destiny! (Ralph doesn’t move) Ralph, come on, move your molasses!
Um, I’ve been thinking--
That’s dangerous.
Who cares about this stupid race, anyway?
That’s not very funny, Ralph.
No, I’m serious. It was really fun to build the kart and everything but maybe you shouldn't do it. That gets her attention.
Ah, hello? Is Ralph in there? I'd like to speak to him please.
Look, what I’m saying is, you can’t be a racer. Her eyes go down to his chest and she sees something.
What? Why would you-- She pulls the Medal of Heroes out of Ralph’s pocket. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) Wait a minute. Where did you get this?
Look, I’m gonna be straight with you; I’ve been talking to King Candy.
King Candy? You sold me out?
You don’t understand.

No, I understand plenty, traitor. She throws the medal at him. It hits him in the face and falls to the ground. She jumps back in the kart. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) You’re a rat. And I don’t need you! I can win that race on my own.
But I’m trying to save your skin, kid! Ralph grabs her and picks her up out of the kart.
Hey! Put me down. Let me go! He sets her down. She immediately makes a dash for the ka Ralph blocks her way. She struggles to get around him.
No, you listen to me. You know what’s gonna happen when the players see you glitching? They’re gonna think the game’s broken.
I don’t care, you’re a liar.
You better care, because if your game goes out of order, you go down with the ship, little sister!

I’m not listening to you! Get out of my way! She gets under his leg and gets back in the kart. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) I’m going to that race! He pulls her out again and holds her by the scruff. She thrashes and kicks at him.
No, you’re not. He hangs her by her hood on the edge of a pointy gumdrop.
Take me down from here, Ralph, right now!
No.... I’m doing this for your own good. He goes over to the kart and raises his fists. She strugg to get free, but can’t.

Wait. Wait. Wait. No. No. No. Please, Ralph! No! Stop! But he doesn’t stop. He destroys the kart. She sobs. Then she glitches and lands on her butt on the ground. The kart is in ruins. Ralph turns to her. VANELLOPE (CONT’D) (heartbroken) You really are a bad guy. She runs sobbing into the mountain entrance. Ralph hangs head. He sighs, then walks over and picks up his medal.
He starts down the road alone.
Ralph rides up on the push cart, wearing his medal. It’s awfully quiet. All the lights are out at the Niceland Apartments, but for a single light in the Penthouse.
The door hangs slightly open. Ralph pushes it the rest of way and steps inside. The place looks like it’s been loot
Hello? Anybody home? Felix? Mary?
Well, you actually went and did it. There, by the bar, stands Gene, pouring one last Martini.
Gene? Where is everybody?
They're gone. After Felix went to find you and then didn’t come back, everyone panicked and abandoned ship.
But--but I’m here now.

It’s too late, Ralph. Litwak’s pulling our plug in the morning. Gene motions towards the balcony. Ralph goes over and loo out. He sees the Out-of-Order sign taped to the console. GENE (CONT’D) But, never let it be said I’m not a man of my word. The place is yours, Ralph. Enjoy. Gene tosses Ralph the keys to the Penthouse. Ralph catche them and looks at them, upset, as Gene grabs his suitcase heads for the door.
Gene, wait. Listen, this is not what I wanted. Gene stops and turns back.
So what did you want Ralph?
I don’t know, I just.... I was just tired of living alone in the
garbage.
Well now you can live alone in the penthouse. Gene leaves.

EXT. PENTHOUSE BALCONY — SHORT TIME LATER Ralph stands there, alone. He looks down at the Medal of Heroes. He shakes his head, disgusted, then throws it. The medal smacks against the game screen. The hit on the screen causes one corner of the tape on the Out-of-Order to release. The sign goes crooked. He looks out the game screen and sees the Sugar Rush cons across the way. It reminds him of the homemade medal Vanellope gave him. It’s still around his neck. He takes off and turns it to the side that says, “You’re my Hero.” He hugs it to his chest and looks back out at the Sugar R game. He notices something... There on the console’s side, are illustrations of all the racers, including Vanellope. BACK ON RALPH: That makes him think...then run off.

location: SUGAR RUSH, THE BASE OF DIET COLA MOUNTAIN

text: Sour Bill loads the scraps of Vanellope’s kart into a can wheelbarrow. A shadow rises over him.
Hey cough drop. Explain something to me... Sour Bill turns to see Ralph, looming, fists on hips.
If Vanellope was never meant to exist, then why is HER picture on the side of the game console?
Uuhhhhbhh... Sour Bill makes a run for it. Ralph grabs him.
What’s going on in this candy- coated Heart of Darkness?
